results.name: Number triangle associated to the Riordan arrays (1/(1+x),x/(1+x)^k),k>=0.
comment: As a number square read by antidiagonals, the rows represent the row sums of the inverses of the Riordan arrays (1/(1+x),x/(1+x)^k), k>=0. The rows are then given by T(n,k)=(n-1)C(n*k,k)-(n-2)*sum{j=0..k, C(n*k,j)}. T(n,n) is A040000, T(n+1,n) is A000079, T(n+2,n) is A000984, T(n+3,n) is A047098. The reverse of this triangle is A107030. Row sums are A107028. Diagonal sums are A107029.
formula: Number triangle T(n, k)=if(k<=n, (n-k-1)C((n-k)*k, k)-(n-k-2)*sum{j=0..k, C((n-k)*k, j)}, 0).
